title: Al - Bureij battalion Salah Jamil Muhammad Emad eliminated by Israel
message:
In the attack, several other terrorists who were with him in the terrorist infrastructure of the organization were eliminated.
IDF airstrike targets Hamas terrorist infrastructure.
At the same time, Gaza Division soldiers attacked a Hamas launching area, which contained rockets that were ready to be launched to Israel's south, with artillery fire.
In the past day, fighter jets and aircraft of the Air Force attacked additional terror targets in Gaza, including military buildings, terrorist infrastructures, and weapons warehouses.
Air Force aircraft directed by the Gaza Division killed three Hamas terrorists in the Jabaliya area, including a deputy company commander and two other terrorists from the organization.

title: 9 of Ukraine deadliest strikes that killed scores of Russians with a single blow US HIMARS and ATACMS take a toll
message:
Some Ukrainian strikes have killed scores of Russian troops with a single blow.
The UK Defense Ministry said on April 27, 2024, that it estimated 450,000 Russian troops had been killed or wounded since the start of the conflict.
The attack killed more than 100 Russian soldiers in one fell swoop, according to OSINT and military analysts.
Russians killed while training on Dzharylhach islandFootage uploaded by Ukraine of a HIMARS strike on a sandbar.
An unnamed Ukrainian official told the Kyiv Post that it was a "funny situation" because the Russian soldiers had made themselves sitting ducks.
event_breakdown:
- Ukrainian strikes killing scores of Russian troops in one blow
- UK Defense Ministry estimating 450,000 Russian troops killed or wounded since the start of the conflict
- Attack killing more than 100 Russian soldiers in one strike, according to OSINT and military analysts
- Russians killed while training on Dzharylhach island
- Ukraine uploading footage of a HIMARS strike on a sandbar
- Ukrainian official calling the situation a "funny situation" because Russian soldiers made themselves sitting ducks

title: Australian police shoot dead  radicalised  teenager after knife attack in Perth
message:
The teenager “rushed” at police who responded by shooting him twice with tasers before firing a single fatal shot, they said.
Western Australian police shot and killed a “radicalised” 16-year-old boy with a knife who stabbed a man in a Perth car park, police and the state premier said on Sunday.
Police body camera images showed the teenager refused officers’ demands that he put down the knife, the police chief said.
03:14 Authorities rule out terrorism in deadly Sydney knife attack Authorities rule out terrorism in deadly Sydney knife attackPolice believe the teenager sent “relevant messages” to some members of the Muslim community who immediately called police, he said, without giving details of the messages.
Two days after the mall attack an Assyrian Christian bishop was brutally stabbed during a live streamed service in western Sydney.
event_breakdown:
1. Teenager rushes at police in unknown location, gets shot with tasers and fatally shot
2. Western Australian police shoot and kill radicalised 16-year-old boy with a knife in Perth car park
3. Police release body camera images of teenager refusing to put down knife
4. Authorities rule out terrorism in deadly Sydney knife attack
5. Teenager sends relevant messages to Muslim community members, prompting police response
6. Assyrian Christian bishop stabbed during live streamed service in western Sydney

title: Hezbollah launches rockets at Israel after deadly south Lebanon strike
message:
Hezbollah launches rockets at Israel after deadly south Lebanon strikeBEIRUTA local official and state media in Lebanon said an Israeli strike on a southern village on Sunday killed several people from the same family, with Hezbollah announcing rocket fire in retaliation.
Israel and Lebanon's Iran-backed Hezbollah group have exchanged regular cross-border fire since Palestinian militant group Hamas's unprecedented October attack on southern Israel sparked the war in Gaza.
Fighting has intensified in recent weeks, with Israel striking deeper into Lebanese territory, while Hezbollah has stepped up its missile and drone attacks on military positions in northern Israel.
A Lebanese security source, requesting anonymity as they were not authorised to speak to the media, confirmed the strike killed "four civilians".
Hezbollah in a statement said it fired "dozens of Katyusha and Falaq rockets" at Kiryat Shmona in northern Israel "in response to the horrific crime that the Israeli enemy committed in Mais al-Jabal".
event_breakdown:
- Israeli strike kills several people from the same family in a southern village in Lebanon
- Hezbollah announces rocket fire in retaliation, launching dozens of rockets at Kiryat Shmona in northern Israel
- Regular cross-border fire between Israel and Lebanon's Hezbollah group
- Israel striking deeper into Lebanese territory
- Hezbollah stepping up missile and drone attacks on military positions in northern Israel
- Intensified fighting between Israel and Hezbollah since Hamas's attack on southern Israel

title: Police in Australia shoot boy dead after stabbing with  hallmark of terrorism
message:
The car park in Perth where the stabbing and shooting occurred - Australian Broadcasting Corporation vi APPolice in Western Australia have shot dead a boy after he stabbed a man in Perth, in an attack authorities said indicated terrorism.
The apparently random attack, in the car park of a hardware store in the suburb of Willetton, had “hallmarks” of terrorism but was yet to be declared a terrorist act, police said.
State Police Commissioner Col Blanch said when police were called to the car park, the youth lunged at officers with the knife and was shot.
“At this stage it appears that he acted solely and alone,” Western Australia Premier Roger Cook told a televised press conference in Perth, regarding the attacker.
The attack on the bishop came only days after a stabbing spree killed six in the Sydney beachside suburb of Bondi.
event_breakdown: The stabbing and shooting incident occurred in a car park in Perth, Australia. Police shot dead a boy after he stabbed a man, with authorities suggesting it indicated terrorism. The attack, in the suburb of Willetton, had "hallmarks" of terrorism but was not declared a terrorist act yet. State Police Commissioner Col Blanch stated that the youth lunged at officers with a knife and was shot. The incident appears to have been carried out solely by the attacker. This incident followed a stabbing spree in the Sydney beachside suburb of Bondi, where six people were killed.

title: Australian police shoot 16 - year - old boy dead after stabbing
message:
Australian police said on Sunday they had shot dead a boy after he stabbed a man in Western Australia’s capital Perth, in an attack authorities said indicated terrorism.
There were signs the 16-year-old, armed with a kitchen knife, had been radicalized online, state authorities said, adding they received calls from concerned members of the local Muslim community before the attack, which occurred late on Saturday night.
The attack, in the suburb of Willetton, had “hallmarks” of terrorism but was yet to be declared a terrorist act, police said.
“At this stage it appears that he acted solely and alone,” Western Australia Premier Roger Cook told a televised news conference in the state capital Perth, regarding the attacker.
The attack on the bishop came only days after a stabbing spree killed six in the Sydney beachside suburb of Bondi.
event_breakdown:
Australian police shot dead a boy after he stabbed a man in Perth, Western Australia.
Authorities indicate signs of terrorism and online radicalization.
Concerned members of the local Muslim community called authorities before the attack.
The incident occurred in the suburb of Willetton and had "hallmarks" of terrorism.
Western Australia Premier Roger Cook stated the attacker acted solely and alone.
This attack follows a stabbing spree that killed six in the Sydney suburb of Bondi.

title: Hezbollah launches rockets at Israel after deadly south Lebanon strike
message: (You can now subscribe to our(You can now subscribe to our Economic Times WhatsApp channelA local official and state media in Lebanon said an Israeli strike on a southern village on Sunday killed several people from the same family, with Hezbollah announcing rocket fire in retaliation.Israel and Lebanon's Iran-backed Hezbollah group have exchanged regular cross-border fire since Palestinian militant group Hamas 's unprecedented October attack on southern Israel sparked the war in Gaza.Fighting has intensified in recent weeks, with Israel striking deeper into Lebanese territory, while Hezbollah has stepped up its missile and drone attacks on military positions in northern Israel.Lebanon's state-run National News Agency said the strike in Mais al-Jabal killed "four people from a single family", updating an earlier reported toll of three dead in the raid it said was carried out by Israeli aircraft.It identified them as a man, a woman and their children aged 12 and 21, and said two other people were wounded.A Lebanese security source, requesting anonymity as they were not authorised to speak to the media, confirmed the strike killed "four civilians".Mais al-Jabal municipality chief Abdelmoneim Shukair had earlier told AFP that three people were killed, saying they were a couple and their son.Hezbollah in a statement said it fired "dozens of Katyusha and Falaq rockets" at Kiryat Shmona in northern Israel "in response to the horrific crime that the Israeli enemy committed in Mais al-Jabal".The Lebanese movement has repeatedly declared that only a ceasefire in Gaza will put an end to its attacks on Israel, which it says are in support of Gazans and its ally Hamas.Both the United States and France have made diplomatic efforts to calm tensions on the Lebanese-Israeli border.In Lebanon, at least 390 people have been killed in nearly seven months of cross-border violence, mostly militants but also more than 70 civilians, according to an AFP tally.Israel says 11 soldiers and nine civilians have been killed on its side of the border.Tens of thousands of people have been displaced on both sides.
event_breakdown:
- Israeli strike on a southern village in Lebanon kills several people from the same family
- Hezbollah announces rocket fire in retaliation towards northern Israel
- Regular cross-border fire between Israel and Hezbollah since Hamas's attack in Gaza
- Intensified fighting with Israel striking deeper into Lebanese territory and Hezbollah increasing attacks on military positions in northern Israel
- Lebanese state-run National News Agency reports four people from a single family killed in Mais al-Jabal strike
- Lebanese security source confirms four civilians killed in the strike
- Hezbollah fires dozens of Katyusha and Falaq rockets at Kiryat Shmona in northern Israel in response to the strike in Mais al-Jabal
- United States and France make diplomatic efforts to calm tensions on the Lebanese-Israeli border
- Casualties reported in both Lebanon and Israel, with hundreds killed and tens of thousands displaced on both sides

title: These are the terrorists eliminated near Tulkarem
message:
The IDF and ISA on Saturday night announced the names of the terrorists killed in a nearly 13-hour operation near Tulkarem.
"Over the last few hours, during a joint IDF, ISA, and Israel Police counterterrorism activity, a Hamas terrorist cell was neutralized in the area of Tulkarem," the statement read.
"As part of the counterterrorism activity, the forces located the terrorists in the town of Deir al-Ghusun and engaged in fire, eliminating four terrorists.
"The four terrorists who were eliminated in the area of Tulkarem were:"1.
Tamer Abed Allatif Rajeh Rajeh - a Hamas operative from the town of Shuweika.
event_breakdown: null

title: Israel nuclear doctrine after Iran aggression
message:
Any continuing Israeli posture of deliberate nuclear ambiguity could cause terrorist-mentoring Iran to overestimate the first-strike vulnerabilities of Israel's nuclear forces.
But if relevant Israeli doctrine were made more obvious to Tehran - that is, if rendered more consistently plain that Israel's nuclear assets met payload and delivery system objectives - Israel's nuclear forces could more reliably serve their existential security functions.
Any continued ambiguity over Israel’s nuclear posture could create the erroneous impression of a state that is unwilling to retaliate.
There are persuasive connections between a selectively disclosed Israeli nuclear doctrine and Iranian perceptions of Israeli nuclear deterrence.
Another concerns the relationship between greater policy “openness” and the perceived capacity of Israel's nuclear forces to penetrate Iran’s active defenses.
event_breakdown:
- Israeli deliberate nuclear ambiguity may cause Iran to overestimate Israel's vulnerability
- Israeli nuclear doctrine made more obvious could enhance Israel's existential security
- Ambiguity over Israel's nuclear posture could create a perception of unwillingness to retaliate
- Selectively disclosed Israeli nuclear doctrine could impact Iranian perceptions of Israeli nuclear deterrence
- Policy "openness" may affect Israel's capacity to penetrate Iran's active defenses

title: IDF eliminates top PIJ commander who helped carry out October 7 attacks
message:
A joint attack by the IDF and the Shin Bet (Israel Security Services) killed one of the top commanders of the Palestinian Islamic Jihad (PIJ), the IDF announced on Saturday.
(credit: IDF SPOKESPERSON'S UNIT)The terrorist, Imam Zerev, was killed by Israel Air Force fighter jets in southern Gaza.
IDF kills Imam Zerev in southern Gaza.
(Credit: IDF Spokesperson's Unit).
Two other terrorists from PIJ were killed in the same air strike.
event_breakdown:
- Joint attack by IDF and Shin Bet killed top PIJ commander Imam Zerev in southern Gaza.
- Two other PIJ terrorists also killed in the same air strike.

title: Explosion at DRC displaced person camp kills at least 9
message:
Local officials and media reports in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo say at least nine people – most of them children – were killed Friday following an explosion or explosions at displaced persons camp in the eastern city of Goma.
From his X social media account, DRC journalist Daniel Michombero reported an explosion at the Mugunga displaced persons camp in Goma.
Witnesses and local officials reported seeing at least nine bodies at the scene and at least 20 wounded.
A local hospital official told the French news agency AFP the facility had received 32 wounded and four bodies.
In a statement on his official X account, DRC government spokesman Patrick Muyaya blamed the Rwandan army and its “terrorist auxiliaries” the M23 rebels for the attack.
event_breakdown:
- Explosion at the Mugunga displaced persons camp in Goma, Democratic Republic of Congo
- At least nine people - most of them children - killed
- At least 20 people wounded
- 32 wounded and four bodies received at a local hospital in Goma
- DRC government spokesman Patrick Muyaya blames Rwandan army and M23 rebels for the attack

title: Hezbollah launches rockets at Israel after deadly south Lebanon strike
message:
May 5, 2024 — Beirut (AFP)A local official in Lebanon and state media said an Israeli strike Sunday on a southern village killed several family members, with Hezbollah fighters announcing rocket fire in retaliation.
Israel and Lebanon's Iran-backed Hezbollah group have exchanged regular cross-border fire since Palestinian militant group Hamas's unprecedented October attack on southern Israel sparked the war in Gaza.
A Lebanese security source, requesting anonymity as they were not authorised to speak to the media, confirmed the strike killed "four civilians".
It later said it fired dozens more Katyusha rockets at Israeli troops and vehicles across the border "as part of the response" to the Mais al-Jabal strike.
The Israeli army told AFP that "about 40 rockets were identified crossing" from Lebanon, "some of which were intercepted".
event_breakdown:
- Israeli strike on a southern village in Lebanon kills several family members
- Hezbollah fighters retaliate with rocket fire towards Israeli troops and vehicles across the border
- Exchange of regular cross-border fire between Israel and Lebanon's Hezbollah group since October attack by Hamas

title: 4 killed in Israeli strikes in S . Lebanon - Xinhua
message:
BEIRUT, May 5 (Xinhua) -- Four people were killed and three others were injured on Sunday in an Israeli airstrike on the southeast village of Mays al-Jabal, Lebanese military sources told Xinhua.
The military sources, who spoke anonymously, said that the missile attack by an Israeli warplane destroyed a house in Mays al-Jabal, killed four people of the same family, and wounded three others, including a member of the Lebanese Civil Defense team.
Meanwhile, the Lebanese armed group Hezbollah said its fighters targeted the northern Israeli city of Kiryat Shmona with dozens of rockets in retaliation to Israeli strikes in southern Lebanon without specifying the casualties.
A Lebanese military source told Xinhua that about 20 surface-to-surface missiles were launched from southern Lebanon toward northern Israel, some of which were intercepted by Israeli Iron Dome missiles.
The confrontations between Hezbollah and Israel have killed 449 people on the Lebanese side, including 283 Hezbollah members and 84 civilians, according to Lebanese security sources.

title: Russo - Ukraine War - 04 May 2024
message:
On 24 February 2022, Ukraine was suddenly and deliberately attacked by land, naval and air forces of Russia, igniting the largest European war since the Great Patriotic War.
"To initiate a war of aggression... is not only an international crime; it is the supreme international crime differing only from other war crimes in that it contains within itself the accumulated evil of the whole."
Lyman axis: the Ukrainian Defense Forces repelled 7x attacks in the vicinities of Serebryans'ke forestry (Luhansk oblast), Terny (Donetsk oblast).
Russian forces fired artillery and mortars at more than 10x settlements, including Nevs'ke (Luhansk oblast), Terny, Yampolivka, Tors'ke (Donetsk oblast).
Kherson axis: Russia does not abandon its intention to dislodge Ukrainian troops from their bridgeheads on the left bank of the Dnipro River.
event_breakdown:
- Ukraine was attacked by land, naval, and air forces of Russia on February 24, 2022, igniting the largest European war since World War II.
- Ukrainian Defense Forces repelled seven attacks near Serebryans'ke forestry (Luhansk oblast) and Terny (Donetsk oblast) along the Lyman axis.
- Russian forces fired artillery and mortars at more than 10 settlements, including Nevs'ke (Luhansk oblast), Terny, Yampolivka, and Tors'ke (Donetsk oblast).
- Russia continued its intention to dislodge Ukrainian troops from their bridgeheads on the left bank of the Dnipro River along the Kherson axis.

title: Terror strikes IAF convoy in J & K , one soldier dead
message:
The attack occurred near Shashidhar when the convoy vehicles were moving towards Sanai Top in the district's Surankote area.
Five Indian Army personnel including two officers were "killed in action" in the Kalakote forest area of Rajouri on November 22.
Two terrorists, including a top commander of LeT identified as Quari, were also killed in the two-day long gunfight.
Quari was said to be the mastermind behind several attacks, including the killing of 10 civilians and five Army personnel in the district.
In May last year, five more Army personnel were killed and a major-rank officer was injured in Chamrer forest during an anti-terrorist operation.
event_breakdown: The attack occurred near Shashidhar as the convoy vehicles were moving towards Sanai Top in the Surankote area of Rajouri district. Five Indian Army personnel, including two officers, were "killed in action" in the Kalakote forest area on November 22. Two terrorists, including a top commander of LeT identified as Quari, were also killed in the two-day long gunfight. Quari was the mastermind behind several attacks, including the killing of 10 civilians and five Army personnel in the district. In May last year, five more Army personnel were killed, and a major-rank officer was injured in Chamrer forest during an anti-terrorist operation.

title: Police shoot dead  radicalised  teenager after he stabbed man
message:
A 16-year-old boy armed with a knife was shot dead by police after he stabbed a man in the Australian west coast city of Perth.
The teenager attacked the man and then rushed at police officers before he was shot, Western Australian premier Roger Cook told reporters on Sunday.
“I don’t want to say he has been radicalised or is radicalised because I think that forms part of the investigation,” he said.
I also want to commend the local Muslim community who had flagged the individual prior with the police,” Mr Wadood added.
In November 2018, a Somalia-born Muslim stabbed three pedestrians in downtown Melbourne, killing one, before police shot him dead.

title: Islamic Jihad commander killed in Rafah , says Israeli army
message: NEW DELHI: A top commander of the Islamic Jihad Rafah Brigade who commanded the Islamic Jihad's elite forces during October 7 attack was killed in an airstrike on Rafah, the Israel Defense Forces (IDF) announced on Saturday, Xinhua news agency reported.Aiman Zaarab "commanded and directed" the Islamic Jihad's special soldiers during the October 7 attack on Kibbutz Sufa and the Sufa military post on the Gaza Strip's border.He also led multiple strikes and had been leading the Islamic Jihads' preparations for a battle against the Israeli forces in the southern Gaza Strip in recent days, according to the statement.In addition to Zaarab, two additional Islamic Jihad operatives were killed during the operation, according to the IDF.Meanwhile, Hamas has said that it would not agree to any Gaza ceasefire that does not involve a complete end to the war.Calling Israeli PM Netanyahu's stance on sending ground soldiers into Rafah as the main stumbling point in ceasefire talks, Hamas official said, "We are eager to reach an agreement, but not at any cost," further adding "full responsibility for insisting on entering Rafah instead of ceasing the aggression".

title: Islamic Jihad commander killed in Rafah : Israeli Army
message:
Jerusalem, May 5: The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) announced on Saturday that Aiman Zaarab, a senior commander of the Islamic Jihad Rafah Brigade, was killed in an airstrike on the southernmost Gazan city of Rafah.
Zaarab directed the Islamic Jihad’s elite forces during the Oct. 7 onslaught on Kibbutz Sufa and the Sufa military post bordering the Gaza Strip, said the IDF in a statement.
Zaarab had “commanded and directed” several attacks, and over the past few days, he led the Islamic Jihads’ preparations for a combat in the southern Gaza Strip against the Israeli military, according to the statement.
Along with Zaarab, two other Islamic Jihad operatives were killed during the strike, the IDF added.
event_breakdown:
- Aiman Zaarab, senior commander of the Islamic Jihad Rafah Brigade, was killed in an airstrike in Rafah, southern Gaza
- Zaarab directed Islamic Jihad's elite forces during the attack on Kibbutz Sufa 
- Zaarab had commanded and directed several attacks and was preparing for combat in southern Gaza against the Israeli military
- Two other Islamic Jihad operatives were killed in the strike

title: Islamic Jihad commander killed in Rafah : Israeli army
message:
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) has announced that Aiman Zaarab, a senior commander of the Islamic Jihad Rafah Brigade, was killed in an airstrike on the southernmost Gazan city of Rafah.
Zaarab directed the Islamic Jihad’s elite forces during the October 7 onslaught on Kibbutz Sufa and the Sufa military post bordering the Gaza Strip, the IDF was quoted as saying on Saturday by Xinhua news agency.
Zaarab had “commanded and directed” several attacks, and over the past few days, he led the Islamic Jihads’ preparations for combat in the southern Gaza Strip against the Israeli military, according to the IDF statement.
AdvertisementAlong with Zaarab, two other Islamic Jihad operatives were killed during the strike, the IDF added.

title: N Korea plotting attacks on embassies , Seoul says
message:
N Korea plotting attacks on embassies, Seoul saysAFP, SEOULSouth Korea’s spy agency yesterday said that Pyongyang was plotting “terrorist” attacks targeting Seoul’s officials and citizens overseas, with the South Korean Ministry of Foreign Affairs raising the alert level for diplomatic missions in five countries.
North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, right, visits the Pyongyang General Control Center at the State Directorate of Aerospace Technology in Pyongyang on Friday.
As a result, the North may be “plotting retaliation” against South Korean embassy staff on such pretenses, NIS added.
This marked the highest number of defections by North Korean elites to the South since 2017, Seoul said.
The consul, also an intelligence agent, had been monitoring Pyongyang’s illicit activities, including drug trafficking and the production of counterfeit banknotes, according to South Korean reports.
event_breakdown:
- N Korea plotting attacks on embassies, Seoul raises alert level
- North Korean leader Kim Jong-un visits Pyongyang General Control Center
- Seoul reports highest number of defections by North Korean elites since 2017
- South Korean consul in a foreign country monitoring Pyongyang's illicit activities

On 24 February 2022, Ukraine was suddenly and deliberately attacked by land, naval and air forces of Russia, igniting the largest European war since the Great Patriotic War.

title: US Marines official reveals details of friendly fire towards IDF drones - Israel News
message:
According to Marine Lt.-Col. Michael Pruden, the IDF destroyed 40% of its own uncrewed aerial systems (UAS).
IDF has previously acknowledged accidental knockdowns of its own dronesPruden clarified that the IDF has also previously acknowledged accidental knockdowns of its drones.
"How am I putting a small UAS in the sky, thousands of these things, and not telling anybody about it, especially your ground-based air defense and counter-UAS [elements]?"
Israel’s current defense system includes Arrow 3, an exoatmospheric hypersonic anti-ballistic missile, and Arrow 2, an endoatmospheric anti-ballistic missile built by Israel Aerospace Industries.
The laser air defense system, the Iron Beam, will join as another line of defense.
event_breakdown:
- Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) destroyed 40% of its own uncrewed aerial systems (UAS), as stated by Marine Lt.-Col. Michael Pruden.
- IDF previously acknowledged accidental knockdowns of its own drones, as clarified by Pruden.
- Israel's defense system includes Arrow 3, an exoatmospheric hypersonic anti-ballistic missile, and Arrow 2, an endoatmospheric anti-ballistic missile built by Israel Aerospace Industries.
- The Iron Beam, a laser air defense system, will join as another line of defense.

title: Rafah offensive and war in Gaza : Threat of a dangerous escalation
message:
Rafah and RegionWithin the region, there is apprehension about the Rafah offensive.
In case of the Rafah offensive going ahead, there is all likelihood that the engagements from Hezbollah into northern Israel will grow.
ConclusionLike the Israeli strike on the Iranian consulate in Damascus, the Rafah offensive too threatens to escalate the conflict if launched.
While the Iran-Israel spat was short, the Rafah offensive could spread very fast.
The only face-saving exit for either of the parties is an early and long lasting ceasefire in Gaza before any offensive in Rafah.
event_breakdown:
- Apprehension about the Rafah offensive in the region
- Likelihood of increased engagements from Hezbollah into northern Israel if Rafah offensive occurs
- Threat of escalation of conflict if the Rafah offensive is launched
- Possibility of fast spread of conflict in case of Rafah offensive
- Need for an early and long-lasting ceasefire in Gaza as a face-saving exit for parties involved in potential Rafah offensive

title: Australian Muslims claim  double standard  in police handling of hate crime incidents – International Shia News Agency
message:
Shafaqna English- Australian Muslims claim ‘double standard’ in police handling of hate crime incidents, ead of the Australian National Imams Council (ANIC) said.
An April 13 knife attack in a mall in Sydney, Australia killed six people before police killed the attacker.
Days later, Australian police said the attacker had mental health problems that led to the isolated act and that the attack was not related to terrorism.
“One was described as a mental health issue, the other one was labeled a terrorist act.
Emphasizing that the language used by police did not help the situation, Al-Suleiman said they conveyed their concerns about a double standard to authorities but got unsatisfactory feedback.
event_breakdown:
- Knife attack in a mall in Sydney, Australia on April 13, 2023, killing six people
- Australian Muslims claim ‘double standard’ in police handling of hate crime incidents
- Australian police state that the attacker had mental health problems, and the attack was not related to terrorism

title: Teenagers and terrorism : What is being done ?
message:
AdvertisementNor is the link yet clear between the six charged this week and the church attacker, though one described him as a “mate”.
They had comprised half of ASIO’s “priority counter-terrorism caseload” just a couple of years ago, and “it’s picked up again”, he said.
ASIO Director-General Mike Burgess told the press club that young terror suspects were not a new problem.
Muslim leaders have slammed authorities for not exploring alternatives to the counter-terrorism raids in Sydney last month.
The speed with which police designated the church stabbing a terrorist incident, just hours after it occurred, remains another source of grievance.
event_breakdown:
- Six individuals were charged this week, with unclear links to the church attacker, although one described him as a "mate."
- These individuals were part of ASIO's "priority counter-terrorism caseload" a couple of years ago, and this concern has resurfaced.
- ASIO Director-General Mike Burgess mentioned that young terror suspects are not a new problem.
- Muslim leaders criticized authorities for not considering alternatives to counter-terrorism raids in Sydney last month.
- There's grievance regarding the quick designation of the church stabbing as a terrorist incident by police, just hours after it happened.

title: Progress in Gaza cease - fire talks , but little chance of ending war
message:
Hamas has called for a complete end to the war and withdrawal of all Israeli forces from Gaza.
A senior Israeli official, speaking on condition of anonymity to discuss ongoing negotiations, played down the prospects for a full end to the war.
Israeli strikes early Saturday on Gaza killed at least six people.
A strike in the Nuseirat refugee camp in central Gaza killed three people, according to hospital officials.
Once inside Gaza, the convoy was commandeered by Hamas terrorists, before UN officials reclaimed it.
event_breakdown:
- Hamas calls for complete end to the war and withdrawal of Israeli forces from Gaza
- Senior Israeli official plays down prospects for a full end to the war
- Israeli strikes in Gaza kill at least six people
- Israeli strike in Nuseirat refugee camp in central Gaza kills three people
- UN convoy commandeered by Hamas terrorists in Gaza, later reclaimed by UN officials

title: Russian attacks across Ukraine kill 4 people , injure 19 over past day
message:
Russian attacks across Ukraine killed four people and injured 19 over the past day, regional authorities said on May 5.
Russian forces targeted nine of Ukraine's oblasts – Chernihiv, Zaporizhzhia, Mykolaiv, Dnipropetrovsk, Sumy, Odesa, Kherson, Kharkiv, and Donetsk.
Russian troops attacked settlements in Donetsk Oblast 19 times over the past day, according to Governor Vadym Filashkin.
Russian forces attacked Kharkiv, targeting the city's Osnovianskyi and Industrialnyi districts.
Russian forces struck the regional center of Odesa Oblast with missiles, injuring a man and two women, Governor Oleh Kiper reported.

title: Sunday morning news brief , May 05 - The Times of India
message:
08:27 (IST) May 05According to police sources, she was found at a farmhouse in Kalenahalli near Hunsur taluk of Mysuru.
She was taken to Bengaluru for questioning.
The farmhouse where she was found allegedly belongs to Rajagopal, said to be Revanna's personal assistant.
event_breakdown:
- A woman was found at a farmhouse in Kalenahalli near Hunsur taluk of Mysuru, according to police sources.
- She was taken to Bengaluru for questioning.
- The farmhouse where she was found allegedly belongs to Rajagopal, said to be Revanna's personal assistant.

title: Iran IRGC Warship Shahid Mahdavi Makes History by Sailing into Southern Hemisphere – Al - Manar TV Lebanon
message:
The Islamic Revolution Guards Corps (IRGC) Navy’s indigenous warship Shahid Mahdavi has made history by crossing the Equator and entering the Southern Hemisphere.
Iranian officials emphasize that the country’s defense capabilities, including missile power, are solely for defensive purposes and are not up for negotiation.
Imam Sayyed Ali Khamenei, Iran’s Supreme Leader, has consistently emphasized the importance of strengthening the country’s defense capabilities to ensure national security.
As the Shahid Mahdavi continues its journey in the Southern Hemisphere, Iran’s commitment to self-sufficiency in defense technology remains unwavering.
The IRGC’s oceangoing warship represents a significant achievement in Iran’s efforts to bolster its military readiness and protect its sovereignty.

title: Australian police kill 16 - year - old boy after stabbing with  hallmark of terrorism
message:
Australian police said on Sunday they had shot dead a boy after he stabbed a man in Western Australia’s capital Perth, in an attack authorities said indicated terrorism.
The attack, in the suburb of Willetton, had “hallmarks” of terrorism but was yet to be declared a terrorist act, police said.
“At this stage it appears that he acted solely and alone,” Western Australia Premier Roger Cook told a televised press conference in the state capital Perth, regarding the attacker.
The attack, in the suburb of Willetton, had “hallmarks” of terrorism but was yet to be declared a terrorist act, police said.
APThe attack on the bishop came only days after a stabbing spree killed six in the Sydney beachside suburb of Bondi.
event_breakdown:
1. Location: Perth, Western Australia
   - Australian police shot dead a boy after he stabbed a man in Perth, indicating terrorism.
   - The attack occurred in the suburb of Willetton and had "hallmarks" of terrorism, though not declared a terrorist act yet.
   - Western Australia Premier Roger Cook stated that the attacker acted solely and alone.

2. Location: Bondi, Sydney, Australia
   - A stabbing spree in the Sydney beachside suburb of Bondi killed six people.
   - The attack on the bishop occurred shortly after the Bondi stabbing spree.

title: Armies need their own drone air force flown by specialist soldiers , study says
message:
The air war in Ukraine has become a cat-and-mouse game where drones must constantly evolve.
RUSI envisions each drone battalion being equipped with everything needed to conduct a variety of UAV operations.
This would include "situational awareness UAVs optimized for tactical reconnaissance; tactical strike UAVs; ISR [reconnaissance] UAVs able to penetrate into operational depth; operational strike UAVs; and platform-launched effects designed specifically to synchronize with and enable other weapons systems."
To support friendly ground troops in contact with the enemy, flocks of expendable reconnaissance drones would operate up to 5 miles beyond the enemy front line.
"It therefore makes sense to concentrate UAV operation if UAVs are parts of a mass precision strike complex," the report concluded.
event_breakdown:
- The air war in Ukraine has become a cat-and-mouse game where drones must constantly evolve.
- RUSI envisions each drone battalion being equipped with everything needed to conduct a variety of UAV operations.
- The envisioned equipment includes situational awareness UAVs optimized for tactical reconnaissance, tactical strike UAVs, ISR UAVs able to penetrate into operational depth, operational strike UAVs, and platform-launched effects designed to synchronize with and enable other weapons systems.
- Flocks of expendable reconnaissance drones would operate up to 5 miles beyond the enemy front line to support friendly ground troops in contact with the enemy.
- The report concludes that it makes sense to concentrate UAV operation if UAVs are parts of a mass precision strike complex.

title: Ukraine wiped out 100 Russian troops at once in a strike showcasing the range and power of its new US ATACMS
message:
Ukrainian forces took out more than 100 Russian soldiers with an ATACMS missile, per OSINT analysts.
AdvertisementA Ukrainian ATACMS long-range missile strike killed more than 100 Russian soldiers in an occupied region 50 miles from the front line, according to OSINT and military analysts.
Osinttechnical said at least one of the missiles struck a gathering of more than 100 Russian soldiers, with hundreds of M74 APAM bomblets falling on them.
The US had previously sent ATACMS with a shorter range to Ukraine, but the versions sent recently can travel about 190 miles — which puts higher-value targets in Ukraine's crosshairs.
The US sent Ukraine ATACMS with a shorter range last fall, which enabled Ukraine to destroy Russian helicopters and airfields behind the front lines, but not go after more distant targets.
event_breakdown:
- Ukrainian forces carried out a missile strike with an ATACMS missile on a gathering of more than 100 Russian soldiers in an occupied region 50 miles from the front line
- OSINT analysts reported that the missile strike resulted in the death of more than 100 Russian soldiers
- Osinttechnical mentioned that the missile strike released hundreds of M74 APAM bomblets on the Russian soldiers
- The versions of ATACMS missiles recently sent by the US to Ukraine have a longer range of about 190 miles, allowing Ukraine to target higher-value distant targets
- Last fall, the US sent ATACMS missiles with a shorter range to Ukraine, enabling Ukraine to target Russian helicopters and airfields behind the front lines

title: Israeli forces kill Hamas gunmen in overnight raid near West Bank Tulkarm
message:
Hamas, the Islamist group which Israel has been fighting in Gaza, had also been building its fighting network in the West Bank before the start of the war.
During the raid, the Israeli army levelled a two-storey house with a bulldozer in an operation that lasted more than 12 hours.
According to Palestinian Health Ministry records, nearly 500 Palestinians have been killed by Israeli forces or Jewish settlers in the West Bank or East Jerusalem since Oct. 7.
Palestinians want the West Bank and Gaza, which Israel captured in the 1967 Middle East war, as the core of an independent state with East Jerusalem as its capital.
More than 34,000 Palestinians have been killed in Israel's seven-month-old assault on the Gaza Strip, say health officials in the Hamas-ruled enclave.
event_breakdown:
- Hamas building its fighting network in the West Bank
- Israeli army levelling a two-storey house in a raid in the West Bank
- Nearly 500 Palestinians killed by Israeli forces or Jewish settlers in the West Bank or East Jerusalem since Oct. 7
- Palestinians seeking West Bank and Gaza as the core of an independent state with East Jerusalem as its capital
- More than 34,000 Palestinians killed in Israel's assault on the Gaza Strip

title: Hezbollah launches rockets at Israel after deadly south Lebanon strike
message:
BEIRUT (AFP): A local official and state media in Lebanon said an Israeli strike on a southern village on Sunday killed several people from the same family, with Hezbollah announcing rocket fire in retaliation.
Israel and Lebanon’s Iran-backed Hezbollah group have exchanged regular cross-border fire since Palestinian militant group Hamas’s unprecedented October attack on southern Israel sparked the war in Gaza.
Fighting has intensified in recent weeks, with Israel striking deeper into Lebanese territory, while Hezbollah has stepped up its missile and drone attacks on military positions in northern Israel.
A Lebanese security source, requesting anonymity as they were not authorised to speak to the media, confirmed the strike killed “four civilians”.
Hezbollah in a statement said it fired “dozens of Katyusha and Falaq rockets” at Kiryat Shmona in northern Israel “in response to the horrific crime that the Israeli enemy committed in Mais al-Jabal”.
event_breakdown: null

title: The US Military China Missile Problem Is Getting Worse
message:
American warships and bases in the Pacific are within reach of an increasingly worrying threat, a daunting missile force unlike any the US has faced in combat before.
With these missiles, China is signaling that it could attack US bases and ships in the region with little to no warning, Clark said.
Department of DefenseThere's a lot more to the Chinese Rocket Force than these weapons, though.
That said, the US and its allies can't afford to assume the Rocket Force won't be ready should conflict come.
In other words, how the US prepares itself and adapts to the Chinese Rocket Force gives it the best shot at avoiding a fight altogether.
event_breakdown:
- American warships and bases in the Pacific are within reach of a threatening missile force from China
- China signaling potential attack on US bases and ships in the Pacific region with little warning
- The Chinese Rocket Force poses a new and significant challenge to American presence in the Pacific
- The US and its allies must not assume that the Rocket Force will not be combat-ready
- US preparation and adaptation to the Chinese Rocket Force is crucial for avoiding conflict
